com.moomoohk.MooCommands

Class CommandsManager

  • java.lang.Object
    • com.moomoohk.MooCommands.CommandsManager

  • public final class CommandsManager
extends java.lang.Object
    This class manages all the Commands created.
    Since:
    2013-11-24
    Version:
    1.0
    Author:
    Meshulam Silk (moomoohk@ymail.com)

    • Field Detail

      • commands

        private static java.util.ArrayList<Command> commands

    • Constructor Detail

      • CommandsManager

        public CommandsManager()

    • Method Detail

      • add

        public static void add(Command command)
        Adds a Command to the commands list.
        This method should never be called explicitly.
        Commands will call this method from their constructor.
        Parameters:
        command - Command to add to the list.

      • findCommand

        public static Command findCommand(java.lang.String command)
        Finds a Command in the commands list.
        Parameters:
        command - The Command to find in String form.

        This String either the Command itself or the command and some parameters.

        Returns:
        The Command corresponding to the String sent. Null if not found.

      • getAllCommands

        public static java.util.ArrayList<Command> getAllCommands()
        Gets the commands list.
        Returns:
        The commands list.

      • executeCommand

        public static java.lang.String executeCommand(java.lang.String commandAndParams)
                                       throws InvalidCommandException
        Executes a Command in the commands list.
        Parameters:
        commandAndParams - The command in String form and any parameters to execute with.
        Theoretically this can be raw user input.
        Returns:
        The output message of the Command executed.
        Throws:
        InvalidCommandException - If the input String's length is 0 or if the command cannot be found.

      • parseParams

        public static java.lang.String[] parseParams(java.lang.String params)
        Will parse the parameters from an input String into a String array.
        For example: "/test param1 param2" will return {"param1", "param2"}.
        Parameters:
        params - The input to parse.
        Returns:
        The parsed parameters.

      • stringParams

        public static java.lang.String stringParams(java.lang.String[] params,
                                            int start)
        Receives a String array and combines all the indexes into one String object.
        Parameters:
        params - A String array of parameters.
        start - The index with which to start combining.
        Returns:
        A String object which contains all the parameters combined starting at the specified index.

      • parseFlags

        public static java.util.HashMap<java.lang.String,java.lang.String> parseFlags(java.lang.String[] params)
        This method receives a String array of parameters which contain flags (which are formatted "flag:value") and will create a HashMap<String, String> which contains the flags as keys and their values.
        Parameters:
        params - String array of parameters where each place contains a flag.
        Returns:
        A HashMap<String, String> which contains the flags and their values.
